description:
**Fix Overview**:

To mitigate the secure boot security feature bypass vulnerability (CVE-2024-37984), it is essential to apply the relevant Windows updates, which address the stack-based buffer overflow issue.

1. Identify the appropriate update package for your Windows version:
   - For Windows 11 Version 23H2 (x64): Download and install KB5040442.
   - For Windows 11 Version 22H2 (x64): Download and install KB5040442.
   - For Windows 11 Version 21H2 (x64): Download and install KB5040431.
   - For Windows 10 Version 22H2 (x64): Download and install KB5040427.
   - For Windows 10 Version 21H2 (x64): Download and install KB5040448.

2. Follow the installation prompts to apply the updates and restart your system to finalize the changes.

**Details**:
The vulnerability enables a bypass of the secure boot feature, which could potentially compromise system security. Applying the updates addresses the underlying buffer overflow vulnerability effectively.
- For installation, visit the following links based on your Windows version:
   - [KB5040442](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5040442)
   - [KB5040431](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5040431)
   - [KB5040427](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5040427)
   - [KB5040448](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5040448)

**Preconditions**:
- Ensure your system is compatible with the updates based on the Windows version.
- Backup critical data before applying system updates to prevent data loss.
